original: Lindgren, Elias (Elis) Erik Samuel, lasarettsdäkare, Ljungby, f. 10/8/93 i Tranås av bokh. Axel L. o. Hedvig Pettersson. G. 30 m. Agnes Eklöf. — Studiex. i Linköp. 12, med. kand. 16 o. med. lic. 22 v. Karol. inst. Div. förordn. som e. läk. o. und :läk. 19-21, und:läk. v. örnsköldsviks las. 22-25, aman. o. und:läk. v. Seraf :las. kir. klin. o. po’liklin. 26-29, tf. las :läk. v. Norrtälje las. två mån. 28, tf. förste und:läk. v. Linköp. las. kir. avd. 29, e. aman. v. Sabbatsb. sjukh. klin. f. öron-, näs- o. halssjukd. 30, förste undiläk. v. Hälsingborgs las. kir. avd. 30-31, v. Örebro las. kir. avd. o. bitr. las :läk. där 31-33, ias:läk. i Ljungby sed. 33. Led. av Deutsche Gesellsch. f. Chir. 33, Soc. internat. de Chirurgie 35, ordf. i Kronob. läns läkifören. 42-43. StadsfuHm. (h) sed. 36, v. ordf. i beredn :utsk. s. à., ordf. sed. 39. Stud:resor t. Wien 31. Berlin 33, Ital. 34, Schweiz 36, Oslo 39. Skr.: avh. i kir. m. fil. frågor.
translated:
Lindgren, Elias (Elis) Erik Samuel, hospital physician, Ljungby, b. 10/8/93 in Tranås to the bookseller Axel L. and Hedvig Pettersson. Married on 30th with Agnes Eklöf. — Graduated from Linköping University in 1912, obtained a Bachelor's Degree in Medicine in 1916, and a Medical License in 1922 from the Karolinska Institute. Various appointments as a medical physician and assistant: 1919-1921 as a physician and assistant, 1922-1925 as an assistant physician at Örnsköldsvik Hospital, 1926-1929 as an assistant physician and assistant at Seraf Karolinska Hospital surgical clinic and outpatient clinic. Temporary appointment as a physician at Norrtälje Hospital for two months in 1928, temporary appointment as the first assistant physician at Linköping Hospital surgical department in 1929, employed as an assistant physician at Sabbatsberg Hospital clinic for ear, nose, and throat diseases in 1930, as the first assistant physician at Helsingborg Hospital surgical department from 1930-1931, at Örebro Hospital surgical department and as a deputy physician there from 1931-1933, and as a physician in Ljungby since 1933. Member of the German Society for Surgery since 1933, the International Society of Surgery since 1935, chairman of the County Medical Association of Kronoberg in 1942-1943. City councilor since 1936, vice chairman of the committee until A., chairman since 1939. Study trips to Vienna in 1931, Berlin in 1933, Italy in 1934, Switzerland in 1936, and Oslo in 1939. Written articles on surgical and medical issues.

Note: The abbreviation "las." stands for "lasarett" which translates to hospital in English.
